alfredsnippet.snippet:
D.L. Hotson, Dirac's Equation and the Sea of Negative Energy, Infinite Energy, Issue 43, 2002, p.1-20

Feynman, who originated the 'renormalization' process (with Schwinger and Tomonaga), himself called it a '... shell game ... Having to resort to such hocus-pocus has prevented us from proving that the theory of quantum electrodynamics is mathematically self-consistent ... [renormalization] is what I would call a dippy process!" 

- Feynman (1985)

Asked for what he had won the Nobel Prize, Feynman replied:

"For sweeping them [the infinities] under the rug."

- Gleick (1992).
